title: Experimental Writing Forms & Overcoming Writer's Block Quiz

questions.question: What is 'stream of consciousness' writing?
choices: Writing about streams and rivers
A narrative technique that presents a character's thoughts and feelings as they occur
Writing while sleepwalking
A technique where the story is written backwards
questions.answer: A narrative technique that presents a character's thoughts and feelings as they occur

questions.question: What is 'free writing'?
choices: Writing without paying for a course
A technique where one writes continuously without regard to spelling, grammar, or topic
Writing while skydiving
Writing only using free verse poetry
questions.answer: A technique where one writes continuously without regard to spelling, grammar, or topic

questions.question: What are 'constraints' in experimental writing?
choices: Physical restraints used while writing
Rules or limitations intentionally imposed on the writing process to spark creativity
Financial limitations on publishing
Time limits for writing sessions
questions.answer: Rules or limitations intentionally imposed on the writing process to spark creativity

questions.question: What is 'erasure poetry'?
choices: Poetry written in pencil and then erased
A form of found poetry created by erasing words from an existing text
Poetry about erasers
The act of deleting all your poetry
questions.answer: A form of found poetry created by erasing words from an existing text

questions.question: What is 'concrete poetry'?
choices: Poetry written on sidewalks
Poetry in which the typographical arrangement of words is as important as the content
Poetry about construction work
Very serious, 'concrete' poetry
questions.answer: Poetry in which the typographical arrangement of words is as important as the content

questions.question: What is a 'lipogram'?
choices: A poem about lips
Writing that deliberately excludes one or more letters
A telegram written in verse
A very short poem
questions.answer: Writing that deliberately excludes one or more letters

questions.question: What is 'metafiction'?
choices: Fiction about metaphysics
Fiction that self-consciously addresses the devices of fiction
Very long fiction
Fiction written using metaphors
questions.answer: Fiction that self-consciously addresses the devices of fiction

questions.question: What is 'found poetry'?
choices: Poetry discovered in old books
A form of poetry created by taking words and phrases from other sources
Poetry about lost and found items
The first poem you find when opening a book
questions.answer: A form of poetry created by taking words and phrases from other sources

questions.question: What is a 'pastiche' in literature?
choices: A type of French pastry mentioned in a story
A work that imitates another artist's style
A mixture of different paint types used in book covers
A technique of pasting different texts together
questions.answer: A work that imitates another artist's style

questions.question: What is 'hypertext fiction'?
choices: Fiction written in very large font
Narrative that uses hyperlinks to create non-linear stories
Extremely exciting fiction
Fiction about hyperactive characters
questions.answer: Narrative that uses hyperlinks to create non-linear stories

questions.question: What is 'writer's block'?
choices: A physical block writers use to support their papers
The inability to produce new work or come up with new ideas
A neighborhood where many writers live
A type of writer's cramp
questions.answer: The inability to produce new work or come up with new ideas

questions.question: What is a common technique to overcome writer's block?
choices: Waiting for inspiration to strike
Free writing or using writing prompts
Giving up on writing altogether
Watching television instead
questions.answer: Free writing or using writing prompts

questions.question: What is the 'Pomodoro Technique' in relation to overcoming writer's block?
choices: Writing only about tomatoes
A time management method involving focused work sessions and short breaks
A technique of writing with your eyes closed
Eating pizza while writing
questions.answer: A time management method involving focused work sessions and short breaks

questions.question: What is 'morning pages' as a technique for overcoming writer's block?
choices: Writing only in the morning
A practice of writing three pages of stream of consciousness text every morning
Pages in a book about mornings
Writing while still half asleep
questions.answer: A practice of writing three pages of stream of consciousness text every morning

questions.question: What is 'freewriting' as a method to overcome writer's block?
choices: Writing without paying royalties
Continuous writing without stopping to edit or censor
Writing while freefalling
Writing only when you feel free
questions.answer: Continuous writing without stopping to edit or censor

questions.question: What is a 'writing sprint'?
choices: Running while writing
A timed session of intensive writing
Writing very small
A competition to see who can write the fastest
questions.answer: A timed session of intensive writing

questions.question: What is 'mindmapping' in relation to overcoming writer's block?
choices: Drawing a map of your mind
A brainstorming technique that visually outlines information
Writing about mindreading
Mapping out your writing desk
questions.answer: A brainstorming technique that visually outlines information

questions.question: What is the 'snowflake method' in writing?
choices: Writing only during winter
A technique for developing a novel from a simple idea to a complete draft
Designing stories in the shape of snowflakes
Cooling down your writing space
questions.answer: A technique for developing a novel from a simple idea to a complete draft

questions.question: What is 'writing cross-handed' as a technique to overcome writer's block?
choices: Writing with your hands crossed
Using your non-dominant hand to write to stimulate creativity
Writing while doing crossword puzzles
A technique of writing collaboratively
questions.answer: Using your non-dominant hand to write to stimulate creativity

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'accountability partners' in overcoming writer's block?
choices: Someone to blame for your lack of writing
A partner who helps keep you motivated and on track with your writing goals
A person who counts your words
Someone who writes your story for you
questions.answer: A partner who helps keep you motivated and on track with your writing goals

questions.question: What is 'chunking' as a strategy for overcoming writer's block?
choices: Eating while writing
Breaking a large writing task into smaller, manageable parts
Writing about food
Throwing chunks of paper at the wall
questions.answer: Breaking a large writing task into smaller, manageable parts

questions.question: What is 'automatic writing'?
choices: Writing done by robots
A surrealist technique of writing without conscious thought
Using a typewriter
Writing that automatically corrects itself
questions.answer: A surrealist technique of writing without conscious thought

questions.question: What is a 'writing ritual' in the context of overcoming writer's block?
choices: A magical ceremony to summon writing ability
A consistent routine or set of actions performed before writing to get into the right mindset
Writing about rituals
A special dance performed before writing
questions.answer: A consistent routine or set of actions performed before writing to get into the right mindset

questions.question: What is the 'two notebook method' for overcoming writer's block?
choices: Writing the same story in two notebooks
Using one notebook for ideas and another for actual writing
Alternating between two different colored notebooks
A method of writing with two hands simultaneously
questions.answer: Using one notebook for ideas and another for actual writing

questions.question: What is 'writing in public' as a technique to overcome writer's block?
choices: Sharing all your writing on social media
Writing in a public place to change your environment and potentially spark creativity
Performing your writing like a stage play
Writing on public walls or surfaces
questions.answer: Writing in a public place to change your environment and potentially spark creativity

questions.question: What is the 'talk it out' method for overcoming writer's block?
choices: Yelling at your computer
Verbally explaining your story or ideas to someone else or recording yourself
Having a conversation with your characters
Arguing with yourself about your writing
questions.answer: Verbally explaining your story or ideas to someone else or recording yourself

questions.question: What is 'temptation bundling' in the context of overcoming writer's block?
choices: Wrapping your writing in a tempting package
Pairing a task you need to do (writing) with something you want to do
Writing about temptations
Bundling all your unfinished manuscripts together
questions.answer: Pairing a task you need to do (writing) with something you want to do

questions.question: What is the 'forest method' of writing?
choices: Writing only about forests
A technique where you write the 'forest' (big picture) before the 'trees' (details)
Writing while sitting in a forest
A method of organizing your desk like a forest
questions.answer: A technique where you write the 'forest' (big picture) before the 'trees' (details)

questions.question: What is 'writing to music' as a technique for overcoming writer's block?
choices: Writing songs instead of stories
Using music as background or inspiration while writing
Writing about music
Playing an instrument while writing
questions.answer: Using music as background or inspiration while writing
